results.title: E.T. the extra-terrestrial (special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg’s heartwarming masterpiece of love between a young boy and a visitor from another planet has quickly become one of the most popular films of all time. Filled with magic and imagination, it made audiences around the world laugh and cry. Follows the story of a lost alien who befriends a 10 year old boy named Elliott. While E.T. learns about life on Earth, Elliott learns that friendship knows no earthly bounds. Overflowing with memorable performances, a stirring musical score by John Williams, its scenes of wonderment invite everyone to share the thrill of its magic. Cast includes Dee Wallace, Peter Coyote, Drew Barrymore and Henry Thomas as Elliott. Spielberg corrected certain scenes on the 20th anniversary edition with visual (computer assisted) improvement.

results.title: Dysphasic school children
results.creator_credit: Louise Janas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Dysphasic children are those who have trouble expressing and understanding language, and are thus unable to take advantage of much classroom teaching. This program outlines the different teaching methods required to help with their speech difficulties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Janas and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Duty free
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A colorful, rollicking account of Nova Scotia’s rum-running days, told in part by mariners who made the runs into forbidden American ports some fifty years ago, and in part by re-enactments of their tales by actors. The sources of their profitable illegal cargoes were the French islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon, quiet enough now, but once busy rendezvous for smugglers.

results.title: Dusty
results.brief_description: Dusty is a film that will captivate with its value of love, loyalty and the quest for freedom. Based on the classic Australian book by Frank Dalby Davison, this is the story of an ill-fated bond between an old man and his dog. Tom Lincoln, an ageing drover, buys Dusty in a hotel, unaware that the dog is part kelpie and part dingo. He trains Dusty into a champion sheep dog and becomes aware his dog has the killer in his blood. Finally he returns to the bush, set apart from the world by his love for his dog.

results.brief_description: An animation film about a clarinet and a trumpet that meet, clash, compete, compromise and harmonise. Sound film without words.

results.title: Ducks, of course
results.creator_credit: John Howe, William H. Carrick, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: That one duck is not necessarily the same as another is made clear in this film, which has as its objective the protection of the dwindling species. The star of the film is a hunter who is obviously light on duck lore but heavy on the trigger. By the time everything has been made clear, he (and the viewer) knows a good deal more about duck identification.

results.title: Duck soup
results.brief_description: The funniest Marx Brothers film is thankfully free of tacked-on studio romance, free of sentimentality and it is joyously anarchic. Groucho is head of the struggling country of Freedonia. Battling power-hungry courtiers and devious politicians, the four brothers have to defend their tiny country from the threat of war. “Duck Soup” includes some of the funniest dialogue and innovative visual comedy in the history of film including the classic “fake-mirror” scene, the lemonade-stand torture scene and the Civil War spoof. This film has inspired directors as diverse as Woody Allen and Stanley Kubrick. “Duck Soup” is hilarious, witty, and vulgar. War has never been so ridiculous, patriotism has never been so wondefully subverted.

results.title: Duck farming: an indonesian tradition
results.creator_credit: Nick Anderson, Peter Donaldson and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Duck farming has been an integral part of Indonesian society for centuries. A Research Institute in Java, set up by the Indonesian and Australian governments, aims to increase productivity by improved breeding and feeding techniques. The film explores the variety of techniques and traditions and, in the process, gives a unique perspective to the complexities of Indonesian society.

results.title: Duck
results.brief_description: Four lucky ducks escape death from hunters when a lonely man takes them into his home and his life. A claymation tale set to original music written by Ollie Brown. Animation by Jesse van den Dungen.

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Dublin
results.brief_description: A practical guide for anyone intending to travel to Ireland’s capital city. Highlights the major cultural attractions and districts. Provides advice on public transport and accommodation. Indicates the best times to visit the main cultural institutions. Suggests places to eat and what you should expect to pay. Includes information on Trinity College, Grafton Street, Waterford Crystal, Powerscourt Gardens, Aran sweaters, literary pub crawls and fishing trips. Presented by John Guerrasio.
